name: accepter
top_desc: Yes, accepter requires the subjunctive:
exfr_1: J'accepte que tu sois toujours en retard.
exen_1: I accept that you are always late.

name: accorder
top_desc: Yes, accorder requires the subjunctive:
exfr_1: J'accorde que tu fasses un meilleur g\u00E2teau que moi.
exen_1: I grant that you make a better cake than I.
exfr_2: Je n'accorde pas que tu fasses un meilleur g\u00E2teau que moi.
exen_2: I don't grant that you make a better cake than I.

name: \u00E0 condition que
top_desc: Yes, \u00E0 condition que requires the subjunctive:
exfr_1: J'ach\u00E8terai la voiture \u00E0 condition qu'elle soit en bon \u00E9tat.
exen_1: I'll buy the car provided that it is in good condition.

name: admettre
top_desc: Admettre may require the subjunctive:
exfr_1: J'admets qu'Alain est paresseux.
exen_1: I admit that Alain is lazy.
exfr_2: Je n'admets pas qu'Alain soit paresseux.
exen_2: I don't admit that Alain is lazy.
exen_3: Do you admit that Alain is lazy?

name: adorer
top_desc: Yes, adorer requires the subjunctive:
exfr_1: J'adore qu'ils soient dans la chambre \u00E0 c\u00F4t\u00E9.
exen_1: I love (the fact) that they are in the next room.
exfr_2: Je n'adore pas qu'ils soient dans la chambre \u00E0 c\u00F4t\u00E9.
exen_2: I don't love (the fact) that they are in the next room.

name: affirmer
top_desc: No, affirmer does not require the subjunctive:
exfr_1: J'affirme que les dates sont correctes.
exen_1: I affirm that the dates are correct.

name: afin que
top_desc: Yes, afin que requires the subjunctive:
exfr_1: Nous partirons maintenant afin que tu sois \u00E0 l'heure.
exen_1: We'll leave now so that you'll be on time.

name: aimer
top_desc: Yes, aimer requires the subjunctive:
exfr_1: J'aime qu'il fasse un effort pour elle.
exen_1: I like that he's making an effort for her.
exfr_2: Je n'aime pas qu'il fasse un effort pour elle.
exen_2: I don't like that he's making an effort for her.
bottom_desc: "Lesson: Aimer \u2013 like vs love"

name: aimer mieux
top_desc: Yes, aimer mieux requires the subjunctive:
exfr_1: J'aimerais mieux que Thomas soit \u00E0 c\u00F4t\u00E9 de toi.
exen_1: I'd prefer that Thomas be next to you.

name: ainsi que
top_desc: No, ainsi que does not require the subjunctive:
exfr_1: Il est en retard\u002C ainsi que j'ai pr\u00E9dit.
exen_1: He's late\u002C just as I predicted.

name: ajouter
top_desc: No, ajouter does not require the subjunctive:
exfr_1: J'ajoute que l'architecture est remarquable.
exen_1: I add that the architecture is remarkable.

name: alors que
top_desc: No, alors que does not require the subjunctive:
exfr_1: Je fais la vaisselle alors qu'elle fait la cuisine.
exen_1: I do the dishes while she cooks.

name: \u00E0 mesure que
top_desc: No, \u00E0 mesure que does not require the subjunctive:
exfr_1: R\u00E9pondez aux messages \u00E0 mesure que vous les recevez.
exen_1: Answer the messages as you receive them.

name: \u00E0 moins que
top_desc: Yes, \u00E0 moins que requires the subjunctive:
exfr_1: Je vais lire\u002C \u00E0 moins qu'ils ne soient pr\u00EAts \u00E0 partir.
exen_1: I'll read\u002C unless they they are ready to go.

name: annoncer
top_desc: No, annoncer does not require the subjunctive:
exfr_1: J'annonce que nous avons un nouveau pr\u00E9sident.
exen_1: I announce that we have a new president.

name: appr\u00E9cier
top_desc: Yes, appr\u00E9cier requires the subjunctive:
exfr_1: J'appr\u00E9cie qu'elle veuille nous aider.
exen_1: I appreciate that she wants to help us.
exfr_2: Je n'appr\u00E9cie pas qu'elle veuille nous aider.
exen_2: I don't appreciate that she wants to help us.

name: appr\u00E9hender
top_desc: Yes, appr\u00E9hender requires the subjunctive:
exfr_1: J'appr\u00E9hende qu'il soit gravement bless\u00E9.
exen_1: I fear that he is gravely injured.

name: apprendre
top_desc: No, apprendre does not require the subjunctive:
exfr_1: J'apprends que le monde est extr\u00EAmement compliqu\u00E9.
exen_1: I'm learning that the world is very complicated.

name: approuver
top_desc: Yes, approuver requires the subjunctive:
exfr_1: J'approuve qu'il prenne un cong\u00E9 sabbatique.
exen_1: I approve of him taking a sabbatical.
exfr_2: Je n'approuve pas qu'il prenne un cong\u00E9 sabbatique.
exen_2: I don't approve of him taking a sabbatical.

name: apr\u00E8s que
top_desc: No, apr\u00E8s que does not require the subjunctive:
exfr_1: Je ferai la vaisselle apr\u00E8s que tu seras au lit.
exen_1: I'll do the dishes after you're in bed.

name: assurer
top_desc: No, assurer does not require the subjunctive:
exfr_1: Je t'assure que Viviane le sait.
exen_1: I assure you that Viviane knows.

name: \u00E0 supposer que
top_desc: Yes, \u00E0 supposer que requires the subjunctive:
exfr_1: \u00C0 supposer qu'elle soit malade \u2026
exen_1: Supposing she is sick \u2026

name: attendre
top_desc: Yes, attendre requires the subjunctive:
exfr_1: J'attends que les gar\u00E7ons fassent leurs devoirs.
exen_1: I'm waiting for the boys to do their homework.

name: au cas o\u00F9
top_desc: No, au cas o\u00F9 does not require the subjunctive:
exfr_1: J'am\u00E8nerai un pull au cas o\u00F9 il ferait froid.
exen_1: I'll bring a sweater in case it's cold.

name: au fur et \u00E0 mesure que
top_desc: No, au fur et \u00E0 mesure que does not require the subjunctive:
exfr_1: Envoie les lettres au fur et \u00E0 mesure que tu les \u00E9cris.
exen_1: Send the letters as (soon as) you write them.

name: au lieu que
top_desc: Yes, au lieu que requires the subjunctive:
exfr_1: Je peux t'acompagner au lieu que tu y ailles tout seul.
exen_1: I could accompany you instead of you going alone.

name: au moment o\u00F9
top_desc: No, au moment o\u00F9 does not require the subjunctive:
exfr_1: Je suis tomb\u00E9 amoureux au moment o\u00F9 je l'ai vu.
exen_1: I fell in love the moment I saw him.

name: aussit\u00F4t que
top_desc: No, aussit\u00F4t que does not require the subjunctive:
exfr_1: Je t'appellerai aussit\u00F4t que nous saurons la r\u00E9ponse.
exen_1: I'll call you as soon as we know the answer.
bottom_desc: "Note that this conjunction is normally followed by the future\u002C rather than the present tense."

name: autant que
top_desc: Autant que may require the subjunctive:
exfr_1: Il va arriver vers midi\u002C (pour) autant que je sache.
exen_1: He'll arrive around noon\u002C as far as I know.
exfr_2: Nous vous remercions tous autant que vous \u00EAtes pour votre soutien.
exen_2: We thank each and every one of you for your support.

name: avant que
top_desc: Yes, avant que requires the subjunctive:
exfr_1: Je vais rentrer avant qu'il ne fasse nuit.
exen_1: I'm going home before it gets dark.

name: avertir
top_desc: No, avertir does not require the subjunctive:
exfr_1: Je vous avertis que l'examen est tr\u00E8s difficile.
exen_1: I warn you that the test is very difficult.

name: avoir besoin que
top_desc: Yes, avoir besoin que requires the subjunctive:
exfr_1: J'ai besoin que tu me fasses une faveur.
exen_1: I need you to do me a favor.
exfr_2: Je n'ai pas besoin que tu me fasses de faveur.
exen_2: I don't need you to do me a favor.

name: avoir envie que
top_desc: Yes, avoir envie que requires the subjunctive:
exfr_1: J'ai envie qu'ils aillent au march\u00E9.
exen_1: I want them to go to the market.
exfr_2: Je n'ai pas envie qu'ils aillent au march\u00E9.
exen_2: I don't want them to go to the market.

name: avoir honte que
top_desc: Yes, avoir honte que requires the subjunctive:
exfr_1: J'ai honte qu'elle fasse des b\u00EAtises.
exen_1: I'm ashamed that she's acting foolish.
exfr_2: Je n'ai pas honte qu'elle fasse de b\u00EAtises.
exen_2: I'm not ashamed that she's acting foolish.

name: avoir l'impression que
top_desc: Avoir l'impression que may require the subjunctive:
exfr_1: Nous avons l'impression que Marie est ici.
exen_1: We have the impression that Marie is here.
exfr_2: Nous n'avons pas l'impression que Marie soit ici.
exen_2: We don't have the impression that Marie is here.
exfr_3: Avez-vous l'impression que Marie soit ici ?
exen_3: Do you have the impression that Marie is here?

name: avoir peur que
top_desc: Yes, avoir peur que requires the subjunctive:
exfr_1: J'ai peur que vous n'ayez tort.
exen_1: I'm afraid you are mistaken.

name: avouer
top_desc: No, avouer does not require the subjunctive:
exfr_1: J'avoue que nous sommes les coupables.
exen_1: I confess that we are the guilty ones.

name: bien que
top_desc: Yes, bien que requires the subjunctive:
exfr_1: Bien que je sache les r\u00E9ponses\u002C je ne veux pas passer l'examen.
exen_1: Even though I know the answers\u002C I don't want to take the test.

name: bien s\u00FBr que
top_desc: No, bien s\u00FBr que does not require the subjunctive:
exfr_1: Bien s\u00FBr que tu peux venir avec nous.
exen_1: Of course you can come with us.

name: \u00E7a m'ennuie
top_desc: Yes, \u00E7a m'ennuie requires the subjunctive:
exfr_1: \u00C7a m'ennuie que tu ne puisses pas assister au mariage.
exen_1: I'm annoyed that you can't attend the wedding.

name: \u00E7a me pla\u00EEt
top_desc: Yes, \u00E7a me pla\u00EEt requires the subjunctive:
exfr_1: \u00C7a me pla\u00EEt que vous veniez \u00E0 la f\u00EAte.
exen_1: I'm pleased that you are coming to the party.

name: \u00E7a m'est \u00E9gal
top_desc: Yes, \u00E7a m'est \u00E9gal requires the subjunctive:
exfr_1: \u00C7a m'est \u00E9gal que tu ne veuilles pas \u00E9tudier.
exen_1: I don't care that you don't want to study.

name: car
top_desc: No, car does not require the subjunctive:
exfr_1: Je ne sors pas car il pleut.
exen_1: I'm not going out because it is raining.

name: \u00E7a vaut le coup
top_desc: Yes, \u00E7a vaut le coup requires the subjunctive:
exfr_1: \u00C7a vaut le coup que vous fassiez le plein.
exen_1: It's worth filling the gas tank.
bottom_desc: "Lesson: \u00C7a vaut le coup"

name: certifier
top_desc: No, certifier does not require the subjunctive:
exfr_1: Le gouvernement certifie que l'eau est potable.
exen_1: The government certifies that the water is drinkable.

name: c'est-\u00E0-dire que
top_desc: No, c'est-\u00E0-dire que does not require the subjunctive:
exfr_1: Il est minuit\u002C c'est-\u00E0-dire que je dois me coucher.
exen_1: It's midnight\u002C which means that I need to go to bed.

name: c'est que
top_desc: C'est que may require the subjunctive:
exfr_1: C'est que je ne sais pas conduire.
exen_1: It's because I don't know how to drive.
exfr_2: Ce n'est pas que je ne sache pas conduire.
exen_2: It's not because I don't know how to drive.
exfr_3: Est-ce que c'est que tu ne saches pas conduire ?
exen_3: Is it because you don't know how to drive?

name: c'est une chance que
top_desc: Yes, c'est une chance que requires the subjunctive:
exfr_1: C'est une chance que nous ayons une place de stationnement.
exen_1: It's lucky that we have a parking space.

name: chercher
top_desc: Chercher may require the subjunctive:

name: commander
top_desc: Yes, commander requires the subjunctive:
exfr_1: Je commande que tu viennes ici tout de suite.
exen_1: I order you to come here right now.

name: comprendre
top_desc: No, comprendre does not require the subjunctive:
exfr_1: Je comprends ce que tu veux dire.
exen_1: I understand what you mean.

name: confirmer
top_desc: No, confirmer does not require the subjunctive:
exfr_1: La h\u00F4tesse confirme que le vol est \u00E0 l'heure.
exen_1: The stewardess is confirming that the flight is on time.

name: conna\u00EEtre
top_desc: Conna\u00EEtre may require the subjunctive:
exfr_1: Je connais quelqu'un qui est v\u00E9g\u00E9tarien.
exen_1: I know someone who is vegetarian.
exfr_2: Je ne connais personne qui soit v\u00E9g\u00E9tarien.
exen_2: I don't know anyone who is vegetarian.
exen_3: Do you know anyone who is vegetarian?
bottom_desc: Conna\u00EEtre (quelqu'un) qui\u00A0may require the subjunctive\u002C depending on whether it is used affirmatively\u002C negatively\u002C or interrogatively:

name: conseiller
top_desc: Yes, conseiller requires the subjunctive:
exfr_1: Je conseille que les parents soient pr\u00E9sents.
exen_1: I advise that the parents be present.

name: consid\u00E9rer
top_desc: Consid\u00E9rer may require the subjunctive:
exfr_1: Je consid\u00E8re que tu as r\u00E9ussi.
exen_1: I consider (think) you've succeeded.
exfr_2: Je ne consid\u00E8re pas que tu aies r\u00E9ussi.
exen_2: I don't consider (think) you've succeeded.

name: constater
top_desc: No, constater does not require the subjunctive:
exfr_1: Je constate qu'elle a une nouvelle voiture.
exen_1: I notice that she has a new car.

name: contester
top_desc: Yes, contester requires the subjunctive:
exfr_1: Nous contestons que vous ayez le droit d'\u00EAtre ici.
exen_1: We dispute that you have the right to be here.

name: craindre
top_desc: Yes, craindre requires the subjunctive:
exfr_1: Nous craignons qu'il ne soit trop tard.
exen_1: We fear that it is too late.

name: crier
top_desc: No, crier does not require the subjunctive:
exfr_1: Je crie que mes fils ont rat\u00E9 \u00E0 l'examen.
exen_1: I'm shouting that my sons failed the test.

name: croire
top_desc: Yes, croire requires the subjunctive:
exfr_1: Je crois qu'il sait la v\u00E9rit\u00E9.
exen_1: I believe he knows the truth.
exfr_2: Je ne crois pas qu'il sache la v\u00E9rit\u00E9.
exen_2: I don't believe he knows the truth.
exen_3: Do you believe he knows the truth?

name: dans le cas o\u00F9
top_desc: No, dans le cas o\u00F9 does not require the subjunctive:
exfr_1: Dans le cas o\u00F9 tu viendrais avec nous\u002C je te ferai un sandwich.
exen_1: In case you come with us\u002C I'll make you a sandwich.
bottom_desc: "Dans le cas o\u00F9 is always followed by the conditional (as is au cas o\u00F9)."

name: dans l'hypoth\u00E8se o\u00F9
top_desc: No, dans l'hypoth\u00E8se o\u00F9 does not require the subjunctive:
exfr_1: Dans l'hypoth\u00E8se o\u00F9 il fait froid\u2026
exen_1: In the event that it is cold\u2026 / If it is cold\u2026

name: d\u00E9cider
top_desc: No, d\u00E9cider does not require the subjunctive:
exfr_1: Je d\u00E9cide que tu vas dormir dans cette chambre.
exen_1: I'm deciding that you are going to sleep in this room.

name: d\u00E9clarer
top_desc: No, d\u00E9clarer does not require the subjunctive:
exfr_1: Nous d\u00E9clarons que cette loi est injuste.
exen_1: We declare that this law is unjust.

name: d\u00E9couvrir
top_desc: No, d\u00E9couvrir does not require the subjunctive:
exfr_1: Je d\u00E9couvre qu'il ne peut pas le faire.
exen_1: I'm discovering that he can't do it.

name: de crainte que
top_desc: Yes, de crainte que requires the subjunctive:
exfr_1: Je suis venu de crainte que tu ne sois en danger.
exen_1: I came for fear that you are in danger.

name: de fa\u00E7on que
top_desc: De fa\u00E7on que may require the subjunctive:
exfr_1: J'ai parl\u00E9 fort de fa\u00E7on que tout le monde peut entendre.
exen_1: I spoke loudly so that everyone could hear. (and they did)
exfr_2: Je parle fort de fa\u00E7on que tout le monde puisse entendre.
exen_2: I'm speaking loudly so that everyone can hear. (at least\u002C I hope they can)

name: d\u00E9fendre
top_desc: Yes, d\u00E9fendre requires the subjunctive:
exfr_1: Je d\u00E9fends que les chiens soient dans la maison.
exen_1: I forbid the dogs to be in the house.

name: demander
top_desc: Yes, demander requires the subjunctive:
exfr_1: Je demande que vous soyez patient.
exen_1: I'm asking you to be patient.

name: de mani\u00E8re que
top_desc: De mani\u00E8re que may require the subjunctive:
exfr_1: J'ai rempli le r\u00E9servoir d'essence de mani\u00E8re que tu peux partir imm\u00E9diatement.
exen_1: I filled the gas tank so that you can leave immediately. (you're ready to go)
exfr_2: Je remplis le r\u00E9servoir d'essence de mani\u00E8re que tu puisses partir imm\u00E9diatement.
exen_2: I'm filling the gas tank so that you can leave immediately. (at least in theory)

name: de m\u00EAme que
top_desc: No, de m\u00EAme que does not require the subjunctive:
exfr_1: De m\u00EAme que tu peux chanter en espagnol\u002C elle peut chanter en anglais.
exen_1: Just as you can sing in Spanish\u002C she can sing in English.

name: de peur que
top_desc: Yes, de peur que requires the subjunctive:
exfr_1: David n'est pas venu de peur que son ex ne soit l\u00E0.
exen_1: David didn't come for fear that his ex would be here.

name: depuis que
top_desc: No, depuis que does not require the subjunctive:
exfr_1: Depuis qu'il a commenc\u00E9 \u00E0 pleuvoir\u002C le sous-sol est humide.
exen_1: Since it started raining\u002C the basement has been damp.

name: d\u00E9sirer
top_desc: Yes, d\u00E9sirer requires the subjunctive:
exfr_1: Je d\u00E9sire que vous sachiez la v\u00E9rit\u00E9.
exen_1: I want you to know the truth.

name: de sorte que
top_desc: De sorte que may require the subjunctive:
exfr_1: Je l'ai expliqu\u00E9 de sorte que tu peux comprendre.
exen_1: I explained it so that you can (and do) understand.
exfr_2: Je l'explique de sorte que tu puisses comprendre.
exen_2: I'm explaining it so that you can (I hope) understand.

name: d\u00E8s que
top_desc: No, d\u00E8s que does not require the subjunctive:
exfr_1: Je vous servirai d\u00E8s que vous serez \u00E0 table.
exen_1: I'll serve you as soon as you're at the table.
bottom_desc: "Note that this conjunction is normally followed by the future\u002C rather than the present tense."

name: d\u00E9tester
top_desc: Yes, d\u00E9tester requires the subjunctive:
exfr_1: Je d\u00E9teste que Marc soit si \u00E9go\u00EFste.
exen_1: I hate that Marc is so selfish.

name: dire
top_desc: Dire may require the subjunctive:
exfr_1: Je dis que son histoire est fausse.
exen_1: I say that his story is false.
exfr_2: Je ne dis pas que son histoire soit fausse.
exen_2: I'm not saying that his story is false.
exfr_3: Dis-tu que son histoire soit fausse ?
exen_3: Are you saying that his story is false?

name: douter
top_desc: Douter may require the subjunctive:
exfr_1: Je doute qu'elles sachent son nom.
exen_1: I doubt they know his name.
exfr_2: Je ne doute pas qu'elles ne savent son nom.
exen_2: I don't doubt they know his name.
exfr_3: Doutes-tu qu'elles ne sachent son nom ?
exen_3: Do you doubt they know his name?

name: \u00E9crire
top_desc: No, \u00E9crire does not require the subjunctive:
exfr_1: J'\u00E9cris que nous allons en France et puis en Italie.
exen_1: I'm writing that we are going to France and then Italy.

name: emp\u00EAcher
top_desc: Yes, emp\u00EAcher requires the subjunctive:
exfr_1: J'emp\u00EAche que le chat ne fasse des d\u00E9g\u00E2ts aux meubles.
exen_1: I'm preventing the cat from doing damage to the furniture.
